meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of an amphitheater.
meanings.sent1: The actors moved amphitheatrically around the stage, engaging the audience from all angles.
meanings.sent2: The concert was set up amphitheatrically, with the stage in the center and seats surrounding it.
meanings.sent3: The children played tag amphitheatrically, running in circles around the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed amphitheatrically in the vast hall, captivating everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The lights illuminated the room amphitheatrically, creating a dramatic atmosphere.

meanings.definition: In a way that relates to or resembles an amphitheater.
meanings.sent1: The building was designed amphitheatrically, with tiers of seating rising around a central area.
meanings.sent2: The garden was laid out amphitheatrically, with plants arranged in concentric circles.
meanings.sent3: The students formed a circle and danced amphitheatrically to the music playing.
meanings.sent4: The sound waves traveled amphitheatrically through the open space, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The clouds gathered amphitheatrically in the sky, resembling a natural amphitheater.
